DOC.detailed_description: Background : Polypharmacy inappropriate medication prescription associate increased morbidity mortality . Most intervention propose improve appropriate prescribing time resource intensive therefore hardly applicable daily clinical practice . Objective : To test efficacy easy-to-use checklist aim support therapeutic reasoning physician order reduce inappropriate prescribing polypharmacy . Design : single-center , interventional , quasi-experimental before-after study . Patients : Consecutive patient age ≥65 year , hospitalize division internal medicine Swiss secondary-level hospital September November 2012 ( control group , N=450 ) September November 2013 ( intervention group , N=450 ) . Intervention : Introduction 5-point checklist use physician internal medicine ward . Main Measures : The proportion patient prescription potentially inappropriate medication ( PIMs ) discharge , accord Screening tool old people 's prescription ( STOPP ) criterion , number prescribe medication discharge , introduction checklist . Secondary outcome prevalence polypharmacy ( ≥ 5 drug ) hyperpolypharmacy ( ≥ 10 drug ) , prevalence potentially inappropriate prescribing omission ( PPOs ) accord START criterion .
